name: Washington Court Hotel on Capitol Hill

reviews.text: Many hotels in mid-May 2007 were full due to conventions and graduation ceremonies. The result was that I experienced 3 different hotels during my 6 day visit to Washington DC. I stayed in the Washington Court Hotel, the Carlyle Suites Hotel and the Washington Suites Hotel Georgetown. Each had advantages and disadvantages.
reviews.title: First class hotel, quiet and relaxing atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Washington Court Hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in, situated next to an attractive and relaxing large atrium, was quick and polite. I had booked a Parlor Room but was given a Deluxe Double Room, which I think was an upgrade. Room 1021 was spacious, extremely well furnished and quiet, albeit looking across a internal quadrangle at other rooms and adjoining offices. Bed pillows were the best I have encountered anywhere. Room provided three phone, one on bedside table, one on desk and one in bathroom, none of which I used, preferring to use my mobile, or cell phone, for North American readers. Iron and ironing board were provided – often not the case in up-market European hotels. One surprising shortcoming was the absence of a refrigerator. Free of charge wireless internet worked well, but I am unclear if I was using the hotel’s Wifi service or the unsecured Wifi of an adjacent office.
reviews.title: Nice Quite Hotel

likes.liked: — layout of public areas - the bar, club bar, pool table game room
likes.disliked: — room floor could have been vacuumed better;

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all three DC hotels I found the bedside lights to be user-unfriendly. If you wake up in the middle of the night one does not want to fiddle around searching for the switch with risk of damaging or knocking over the lamp. Hotel interior designers – please note.
reviews.title: Good hotel, wonderful city, village mentality

likes.liked: — The location, close to Union Station, the Capitol, and transportation for tourists
likes.disliked: — The lack of a swimming pool and other entertainment options

reviews.title: Capitol Hill area hotel
reviews.text: Bathroom was well equipped with shower and bath and mini TV and a good array of towels and face flannels. Soaps, shampoos, coffee and tea replenished each day – not always the case in many hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient location, fair price for the quality we’ve received. Hotel is pretty old though, but well maintained to my opinion, any price around 100USD is fair enough. Use the valet parking at the hotel – there is a public parking around the corner but they overcharge and the personnel there is highly rude.
reviews.title: Nice location, old property

reviews.text: I spent 10 nights at the Washington Court Hotel in early June (for a meeting) and found it to be nice. The room was ok, the bed was comfortable, the pillows were normal hotel pillows (mushy), the sitting area was nice as an alternative to watching tv on the bed. I agree with the previous review that the bath mat on the bathroom floor was dangerous, I nearly slipped on it every night I was there! I did not have trouble with the tv remote or with noise from other rooms, so I guess I was lucky. The restaurant was pretty good, though I was less than impressed with the room service options (no chocolate ice cream, only rocky road!). We had catered meals for our meeting from the hotel and the food was ok for that too. The conference facilities were standard, though the ac was either cranked to 62 or off. My one complaint was with the concierge of the hotel. I had done research on what museums had evening hours during my stay so I could see some DC sights. When I asked for directions, the concierge told me the museum wasn't opened and when another lady at the desk offered to look online, she insisted it wasn't open. Needless to say, I walked over there using a map, and found the museum opened! I brought her a copy of the brouchure when I returned and she just huffed at me! Also, Capitol Hill doesn't have the greatest selection of restaurants nearby, though Senators in the Holiday Inn next door was good. Also, there are lots of places to eat in Union Station, though it was very loud! Finally, there is no plug in internet in the room, you need a wireless card. Overall, the room was comfortable and that was the important thing for this trip.
reviews.title: Not an exceptional hotel, but pretty nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed with this hotel. They have some big problems. It was clean, and has a large lobby area, but those are the highlights. We got there early, and were told we could get in before the 4 pm. check-in. They kept our luggage, and told us to return at 2 pm. We returned at 2 and ended up sitting in the lobby for hours, and in fact, finally got our rooms after 4 pm. The "sitting area" that is shown on their website in a double room is very deceptive. There is no separate area, and we had one chair next to the bed, and an average writing desk in the corner. The "Italian marble" bathroom they claim amounts to the marble floor. Be careful, it's slippery when they put down a little rug with no backing, one in our party slipped and fell on it. We had two rooms on the fourteenth floor, and one (1406) was definitely nicer than the other (1411). Luck of the draw on if you get a nice room. In your room there is a nice little stand-up card that announces their Happy Hour....with Happy Hour Specials, and free appetizers, down in their lounge. When we got to the lounge and saw no indication of it, the bartender told us "Oh, that was a long time ago...we don't have that any more." I believe they shouldn't advertise what they don't have. Also, pillows and beds were terrible. Very hard time trying to sleep between the poor beds and the doors slamming all night. The beds had feathers poking us during the night, sharp ends that poked right through the sheets. Pillows were also feathers and very poor for head support. Remote to the tv barely worked, the buttons stuck and wouldn't move the channels. We called on it, and a "repairman" came and said all the remotes were like that, because they were new. New remotes don't stick, old ones might. Front desk staff not very friendly or helpful. Good points were that our rooms were cleaned decently, and the proximity to Union Station is convenient. For the money, we wouldn't go back. Avoid the grille across the street as well...don't ask.
reviews.title: We Were Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel online and booked through their website.
reviews.title: Perfect location but issues in the hotel

reviews.text: It's very convenient as it is very close to Union Station and The Mall.
reviews.title: an excellent choice

reviews.text: Excellent, excellent two night stay in February. This hotel is nearly perfect - great location, staff & rooms. Front desk staff and restaurant staff were very professional and responsive. The room is pretty large, great big bathroom, too. And everything is SPOTLESS. This is a great hotel in DC. Highly recommended. The only flaw I could see was that the carpet in my room was somewhat worn near the bathroom, but hardly noticeable. This is a fine hotel.
reviews.title: I agree - one of Washington's best kept secrets - GREAT hotel

reviews.text: I've been staying in Washington hotels on frequent business trips for 25 years and thought I knew all the good and not so good hotels until this week when a conference took me to this hotel for the first time. What a gem!! It appears to be recently refurbished and it is tastefully done. The lobby has lots of comfortable seating for small informal meetings. The meeting rooms are nicely done, as are the rooms for overnight guests. This is a very business-friendly hotel that I would also choose next time I need a hotel for a social trip. I really liked the ambiance, and the food in the restaurant was great! I had four meals there and each was terrific. Best of all, the price is modest by Washington standards. Great value for what this hotel delivers.
reviews.title: One of Washington's best kept secrets

likes.disliked: — Not a great location for meetings on K Street and not very close to the Metro

reviews.text: must beatiful hotel ever, service is great, we arrived at 4 am, in the rooom within 5 min, we had an excellent sleep, recomending this hotel as a high class, nice place, just near all tourist attractions, very nice staff, gentle, and well knowing the area, very helpfull with all you need, one thing we did not like was, that parking is $30 a night, we did not know this untill we got bill at check out, would stay there again!
reviews.title: excellent hotel
This hotel rocks!
reviews.text: This was my first time visiting DC, so I used Trip Advisor to narrow down my hotel choices. Washington Court Hotel rocks. I arrived late and it was not a problem. The front desk was helpful and polite. I ended up eating in the bar and the food was decent. The barstaff was polite and engaging.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel at a great price
reviews.text: I booked the deluxe king. The room was spacious. The bathroom was large and had added amenities that were helpful. The bed was not the most comfortable that I have ever slept in, but was okay. My room faced New Jersey Ave and I had a decent view of the Capital.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at about 10am and the hotel was only about a 1 1/2 block walk from Union Station. The bellman stored our bags until we could check in, so we wouldn't have to drag them around. The hotel is beautiful and very clean, and the staff is friendly. The bathroom is big and beautiful just as the website had said. The location is also a plus. You have a view of the capitol from some rooms. It is also close to the metro which is the best way to get around.
reviews.title: Wonderful location for train arrivals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed right after christmas in 06'. This is evidently the off season for DC because the rates were cheaper than usual. We stayed her after finding it on hotels.com. This hotel looked great and it looks great when you get there. And for only $92 a night it was a bargain. Its "near" enough to union station which will get you anywhere you want to go plus lots of food to eat. The staff was very polite and talkative in the good way. Now im rating this hotel as above average because i feel that it was a decent stay for a decent "price". BUT BE WARNED.... i was charged the room charge which was $316 but then also i was charged $512 out of the blue. I couldnt check my account till i got home so i still used the card and i am now in the hole a good $186. I called and they said that it was because someone must have "charged" my card instead of putting a "hold" on it when we first checked in. I asked to have this fixed and he said id have to wait three days for the accounts person to return. I will not be staying here again because of this issue. If they cant handle my money then im not going to do any business with them. I am now dealing with alot of bank issues just because a front clerk "charged" instead of "held" my card.
reviews.title: Read This

reviews.text: We stayed overnight at the Washington Court Hotel and had an enjoyable stay. Location is great--walking distance from Union Station, slightly downhill even. Very close to the Capitol, Botanic Garden, etc. We stayed on a Friday night and found the area quiet at our 10pm arrival.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our overnight stay

likes.liked: — Location and upscale feel of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was really nice! Nicely decorated and upscale with a marble bath and nice amenities. Even a tiny TV in the bath, though we didn't cut it on. The bed was nice and had feather pillows and a feather pillowtop--this is a great idea in theory, however, I had to put on long sleeves for sleeping because I kept getting poked by feathers during the night. Our room had a view of the street and the office building across the way, and the now ubiquitous starbucks on the corner.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was quick and the elevators speedy. Because I reserved through the hotel website, we received a voucher for free breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. We weren't given this at check-in and remembered later and had no problem getting the voucher from the front desk. Breakfast was nothing to write home about, but it was free and quick.
reviews.title: Superb!

description: A sophisticated, independent hotel located in downtown Washington DC, the Washington Court Hotel offers the ultimate in modern design and hospitality. Boasting a central location near Union Station and Capitol Hill, the Washington Court Hotel is a 265 room distinguished downtown destination for both business, leisure travelers and DC’s elite. Guests at the Washington Court Hotel can explore the rich history of Washington DC just by stepping outside our front doors. Situated adjacent to Union Station, our 16-story property is located in the heart of the distinctive Capitol Hill neighborhood providing access to the National Mall, renowned monuments, free museums and the U.S. Capitol. Luxuriate in world-class surroundings, complete with Italian marble bathrooms, well-lit vanities, and haute technology including flat-screen TVs and high-speed wireless Internet access. As a truly exceptional destination among downtown Washington DC hotels, Washington Court Hotel is an inspired choice for discerning visitors of Capitol Hill. At Washington Court Hotel, your experience plays center stage to everything we do. A family-friendly adventure, business outing or solo excursion – our helpful staff is at your disposal to set the tone for an experience that is unrivaled on “The Hill”.
